title: American Chocolate Chip Cookies
steps: Knead butter, sugar, and molasses by hand until a smooth, uniform mixture forms.
Mix the sugar mixture with the egg and vanilla extract using a hand mixer.
Combine flour, baking soda, and salt in a separate bowl, then sift into the sugar mixture.
Add the chocolate chips to the dough and knead until evenly distributed.
Cover the dough and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 180°C (conventional).
Using an ice cream scoop, place dough portions onto a parchment-lined baking sheet (about 6 cookies per sheet).
Bake on the middle rack for 8-10 minutes.
Let cookies cool completely before serving.
hints: For an especially caramel-like flavor, let the dough rest overnight.
The cookies will look underbaked after baking – they'll settle slightly as they cool.
The cookies taste best when slightly chewy and still soft inside.

title: New York Cheesecake
steps: Crush the butter cookies, mix well with melted butter, and press onto the bottom of a springform pan.
Pre-bake at 180°C (conventional) for 5-10 minutes.
Mix the sugar with cornstarch, cream cheese, and quark until creamy.
Add the egg, cream, and lemon juice, stirring until smooth (stir slowly, don't beat!).
Spread the cream over the pre-baked crust and bake for about 45 more minutes.
Mix the topping ingredients, spread over the cake, and bake for another 5 minutes.
Best if cooled overnight.
hints: Don't beat with a mixer – stir slowly and gently. This is very important!
Let the cake cool overnight for the best consistency.
Remove from oven when the edges are lightly browned.

title: Heaven Cake with Sour Cherries
steps: Beat butter, 125 g sugar, 4 egg yolks, and 1 whole egg until fluffy.
Sift flour with baking powder and fold in.
Divide batter between the 2 pans.
Beat 4 egg whites until stiff, gradually adding 200 g sugar.
Spread half of the meringue on each cake layer and sprinkle with almonds.
Bake both layers at 160°C (convection) for 25-30 minutes.
Cut one layer into 12 pieces immediately after baking.
Place a cake ring around the larger layer.
Drain cherries (reserve juice), make pudding with the juice, add cherries, and spread on the base.
Let cool, whip cream until stiff, spread over the cherries.
Arrange the 12 cake pieces on top.
hints: Don't worry if the batter looks very thin – the meringue creates wonderful layers!
Cutting the layer right after baking is important so the cream doesn't get squeezed out later.
The cream can also be piped onto the cherries for a prettier look.

title: Black Forest Cherry Cake
steps: Beat egg yolks with water and sugar until very creamy and sugar crystals are no longer visible.
Mix flour, cornstarch, baking powder, and cocoa, then sift over the egg mixture.
Beat egg whites until stiff and fold everything together gently.
Pour into a greased, floured springform pan and bake at 200°C for 30-35 minutes (reduce temperature toward the end).
Drain cherries over a bowl to catch the juice. Mix cornstarch with cold juice, boil remaining juice, stir in starch mixture.
Set aside 16 nice cherries, mix the rest into the cherry pudding.
Cut the cake horizontally into 3 layers. Drizzle the bottom layer with kirsch and spread with cherry mixture.
Whip cream with stabilizer and sugar until stiff.
Spread a thin layer of cream on the cherry mixture, add the next layer, drizzle with kirsch.
Spread half of the remaining cream, add the top layer.
Frost the entire cake, pipe 16 rosettes, top with reserved cherries, and cover with chocolate shavings.
hints: Reduce temperature during baking so the sponge doesn't collapse.
The cherry pudding burns easily – remove from heat immediately!
This cake also looks great in a heart-shaped pan!

title: The World's Best Cheesecake
steps: Quickly knead together the shortcrust ingredients and set aside.
Mix margarine, sugar, vanilla sugar, pudding powder, and eggs.
Fold in quark and sour cream.
Whip the heavy cream until stiff and fold in.
Preheat oven to 180°C (conventional).
Press shortcrust into a greased 26 cm springform pan, pulling it about 2-3 cm up the sides.
Pour in the filling and smooth the top.
Bake on the second rack from the bottom for 1 hour.
hints: Only remove the cake from the pan after it has completely cooled!
The quark mixture is still too soft right after taking it out of the oven.

title: Drip Cake (Birthday Cake)
steps: Melt butter and let cool. Preheat oven to 180°C.
Beat eggs with sugar and vanilla sugar for 2 minutes, briefly fold in flour mixed with baking powder, stir in butter.
Pour into springform pan and bake for about 55 minutes in the lower third.
Let cool, then cut horizontally into three layers.
Beat cream mix with soft butter and cold milk until stiff for 2 minutes, fold in chocolate shavings.
Layer the cake bases with cherry jam, cream, and cherries, refrigerate for at least 3 hours.
Beat butter with powdered sugar for the outer coating, thinly frost the cake, refrigerate for 2 hours.
Prepare glaze and apply as drips along the edge.
Decorate with cream, sugar decorations, and chocolate motifs.
hints: The cake must set in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours.
Let the glaze rest for 15-18 minutes before applying.
Pre-draw motifs from glaze on parchment paper and let them dry.

title: Earl Grey Cake
steps: Heat milk with tea leaves for 5 minutes, let cool, and strain.
Sift flour, baking powder, salt, and cornstarch together.
Preheat oven to 175°C, line three 15 cm pans with parchment on the bottom.
Cream oil, butter, and sugar for 4 minutes until light and fluffy.
Slowly add eggs and vanilla, mixing well.
Alternately fold in flour mixture and tea-infused milk.
Divide batter among pans and bake for 18-20 minutes.
For simple syrup: Heat water with tea, dissolve sugar.
For compote: Cook blueberries with sugar and cornstarch until thickened.
For buttercream: Beat butter with powdered sugar, milk, and vanilla until fluffy.
Brush cake layers with syrup, layer with buttercream and compote.
hints: Always spoon-measure flour, never scoop directly with the cup.
Sift dry ingredients to keep the cake light and airy.
DO NOT grease the pans – only use parchment on the bottom.
Freeze the assembled cake before cutting for clean slices.

title: Frieda's Amazing Braided Bread
ingredients: 1 tbsp lemon zest or 5 drops bitter almond extract
steps: Sift flour into a large bowl.
Warm milk slightly, add sugar and crumbled yeast, stir until dissolved.
Add lemon zest and eggs, mix well.
Pour liquid into flour, add soft butter and salt, knead vigorously.
Knead until the dough is elastic and smooth (about 10 minutes by hand).
Cover with a damp cloth and let rise until doubled (about 2 hours).
Knead dough again and divide into two halves.
Form long, tapered rolls and twist around each other in a spiral.
Place on baking sheet, brush with beaten egg, sprinkle with pearl sugar.
Let rise for 30 minutes.
Bake at 160°C (convection) for 30-35 minutes.
hints: Don't add flour while kneading – the stickiness disappears with proper kneading.
Add a pinch of sugar and salt to the egg wash to prevent the braid from turning black.
Knock test: The braid should sound hollow when tapped on the bottom.
Do the windowpane test to check for proper consistency.

title: Fruity Sour Cream Cake with Mirror Glaze
steps: Make sponge batter: Melt butter, beat eggs with water and sugar.
Fold in flour mixed with baking powder, stir in butter.
Bake at 180°C for about 30 minutes, let cool, and slice horizontally.
Soak gelatin, whip cream until stiff.
Mix sour cream, quark, lemon juice, and sugar, fold in dissolved gelatin.
Fold in whipped cream, place base in cake ring.
Layer cream, berries, and second cake layer, freeze for at least 4 hours.
Make syrup from glucose.
For glaze: Mix gelatin, white chocolate, syrup, and condensed milk.
Color part pink, pour over frozen cake and create marbled effect.
Thaw overnight in refrigerator.
hints: The cake must be frozen for at least 4 hours.
Pour the glaze over the frozen cake for a perfect mirror effect.
DO NOT let the glaze cool in the refrigerator.

title: Cherry Cake
steps: Wash, pit, and drain the cherries.
Cream butter with sugar until white and fluffy.
Add eggs one at a time.
Mix flour with salt, baking powder, and lemon zest, then stir in.
Pour batter into a prepared 26 cm springform pan and smooth the top.
Distribute the drained cherries evenly over the batter.
Bake at 175°C (conventional) on the middle rack for 35-45 minutes.
hints: The cake doesn't rise very high, but it's wonderfully moist and delicious.
Dust with powdered sugar before serving if desired.
Drained jarred cherries can be used if fresh ones aren't available.

title: Marzipan Cake with Chocolate Glaze
steps: Preheat oven to 180°C (conventional).
Coarsely grate marzipan and mix smooth with Amaretto.
Grease the loaf pan.
Beat soft butter with sugar and salt until white and fluffy.
Add eggs one at a time, continuing to beat.
Mix flour with baking powder and alternately fold in with the marzipan mixture.
Pour batter into pan and bake in the lower third for about 60 minutes.
Do the toothpick test: No batter should stick.
Let cool completely in the pan.
Melt both chocolates separately in a double boiler.
Pour dark chocolate over the cake, let set briefly.
Drizzle milk chocolate on top.
hints: Do the toothpick test after baking – no batter should stick.
Let the cake cool completely before glazing.
Drizzle the milk chocolate finely over the cake with a teaspoon.

title: Chocolate Mousse
steps: Separate eggs, whip whites and cream separately until stiff.
Carefully melt butter and chocolate in a double boiler.
Beat egg yolks with 2 tbsp hot water in a large bowl until creamy.
Stir in sugar until the mixture is light and creamy.
Fold in the melted chocolate.
Immediately fold in egg whites and whipped cream (don't use an electric mixer!).
Refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
hints: Don't use an electric mixer to fold – use a large whisk or spatula instead.
Don't serve too cold.
Garnish with chocolate shavings if desired.

title: Austrian Sacher Torte
steps: Preheat oven to 190°C (conventional).
Melt chocolate in a double boiler and let cool slightly.
Beat egg whites with granulated sugar until stiff peaks form.
Cream soft butter until fluffy, stir in melted chocolate.
Mix in powdered sugar, vanilla sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Beat in egg yolks one at a time.
Gently fold in egg whites and flour.
Pour batter into a greased and floured cake pan.
Bake at 170°C for about 60 minutes.
Let cool and remove from pan.
Warm the jam and brush over the top and sides of the cake.
Coat evenly with chocolate glaze and let set.
hints: Serve the torte with whipped cream.
Warm the jam slightly before spreading.
Spread the glaze evenly over the entire cake.

title: Moist Lemon Cake
steps: Preheat oven to 175-195°C (conventional).
Zest all 3 lemons, juice 2 of them.
Beat eggs and sugar until fluffy.
Sift flour and gradually add with vanilla sugar, baking powder, lemon zest, and margarine.
Mix everything well.
Spread batter onto a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Bake on the middle rack for about 20 minutes.
Mix lemon juice and powdered sugar into a thick glaze.
Poke holes all over the warm cake with a fork.
Quickly spread the glaze over the warm cake.
hints: Be very sparing with the lemon juice – the glaze must be thick!
Poke holes in the cake so the glaze can soak in and make it moist.
Spread the glaze while the cake is still warm.

title: Grandma's Spritz Cookies

equipment: Meat grinder with cookie press attachment

steps: Knead all ingredients into a firm dough.
Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Press dough through a meat grinder with a cookie press attachment.
Form into desired shapes.
Place cookies on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Bake at 180°C (conventional) on the second rack from the bottom for 10-15 minutes.
hints: All ingredients should be at the same temperature when preparing.
Bake sheets one at a time, as they cool down too much otherwise.
Optionally dip in melted dark couverture.

title: The Best Chocolate Cake Ever
steps: Preheat oven to 175°C. Prepare two 23 cm cake pans.
Mix flour, sugar, cocoa, baking powder, baking soda, salt, and espresso powder in a large bowl.
Add milk, oil, eggs, and vanilla to the flour mixture and mix well on medium speed.
Reduce speed and carefully stir in the boiling water.
Divide batter evenly between the two pans.
Bake for 30-35 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.
Cool for 10 minutes, then remove from pans.
Let cool completely and frost with Chocolate Buttercream Frosting.
hints: The batter will be very thin after adding the boiling water – this is correct!
This makes the moistest and most delicious chocolate cake!
Baked layers can be frozen for up to 2 months.

title: Classic Tiramisu
steps: Beat egg yolks and powdered sugar until white and fluffy.
Stir in Amaretto.
Gently fold in mascarpone (don't use a mixer – use a whisk or spatula!).
Beat egg whites until stiff and fold in.
Briefly dip ladyfingers in cold coffee and drain on paper towels.
Layer cream in a dish, then ladyfingers.
Repeat until everything is used up.
Refrigerate for 2-4 hours (overnight is best).
Dust with cocoa powder just before serving.
hints: DO NOT use a mixer for the mascarpone – it will become liquid!
Use a large whisk or spatula instead.
Refrigerate overnight for the best consistency.

title: Great-Grandma's Vanilla Crescents
steps: Knead all dough ingredients together well.
Form into rolls about 4 cm in diameter.
Wrap in foil and refrigerate for 30-60 minutes.
Sift powdered sugar into a large container with a lid, mix with vanilla sugar.
Cut chilled dough rolls into 1-2 cm thick slices.
Shape each slice into a crescent.
Place on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Bake at 175°C (convection) for 10-15 minutes until they begin to brown.
Let cool for about 3 minutes.
While still warm, roll in the powdered sugar mixture.
hints: If too warm, the crescents break easily; if too cold, the powdered sugar won't stick.
Bake sheets one at a time.
Stored in a tin between wax paper, the crescents keep for 3-4 weeks.

title: Vegan Vanilla Layer Cake
ingredients: 560 g wheat or light spelt flour
steps: Mix plant milk with apple cider vinegar and let stand 5-10 minutes (vegan buttermilk).
Preheat oven to 180°C, grease three 20 cm springform pans and line with parchment.
Mix flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
Beat aquafaba for 1 minute until foamy.
Cream vegan butter, oil, and sugar for 2-3 minutes until light and fluffy.
Mix in whipped aquafaba and vanilla.
Alternately add flour mixture and vegan buttermilk (don't overmix!).
Divide batter among pans and bake for 30-35 minutes.
Cool for 20 minutes, then remove from pans.
For buttercream: Beat soft vegan butter until fluffy, fold in cream cheese, powdered sugar, and lemon juice.
Layer and frost the cakes with buttercream.
hints: The vegan butter must be soft, but NOT melted!
Don't overmix or the cake will be tough instead of fluffy.
Wrapped individually, the cakes keep in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
The buttercream gets firmer when chilled and softer at room temperature.

title: Russian Honey Cake
steps: Preheat oven to 190°C, line baking sheet with silicone mat.
Cook 180 ml honey over medium heat until darker and caramel-scented (about 10 min).
Turn off heat, whisk in cold water – this is the burnt honey.
In a large metal bowl over lowest heat: Melt sugar, butter, 180 ml honey, and 60 ml burnt honey.
Mix baking soda, cinnamon, and salt.
Whisk eggs into the warm butter mixture, then whisk in baking soda mixture.
Sift flour in 2-3 additions and stir until spreadable.
Spread about 120 ml batter on the silicone mat into a 20-23 cm circle.
Bake for 6-7 minutes until lightly browned.
Repeat until 8 cake layers are baked.
Bake scraps into crumbs.
Whip cream until soft peaks, add sour cream and remaining burnt honey, whip to stiff peaks.
Layer cakes with frosting, cover with crumbs.
Refrigerate for at least 8 hours or overnight.
hints: The secret to this cake is the slight bitterness from the burnt honey.
Let each layer cool on its own parchment paper round.
Trim edges with a pizza cutter.
Must rest for at least 8 hours, preferably overnight, in the refrigerator.
